response.answer_text: They were obsoleted by the widespread availability of high definition, on-demand streaming content that easily exceeds the quality of the material you can fit onto a DVD.

To expand on Andrew Silverman’s answer: They were obsoleted as a video medium by Blu-Ray discs, high-speed downloads, and on-demand streaming video. They were also obsoleted as a data storage medium by cheap flash memory and portable hard drives with far more capacity and faster access speeds, for much lower prices.
